npcs.name: Assistant Jalan
utterances: Welcome to the bank, citizen. How can I assist you?

npcs.name: Assistant Tillheel
utterances: What happened to the highly explosive bottle that was on my desk?  Have you seen it?
I'm sorry, afraid I'm unable to help you now.  That dolt Mr. Clark mixed up the formulas again!  Now... Let's see...  Which one is the super corrosive acid?
There are no refunds for caster error at this shop! Oh ... hello you're not here about a refund.
Hello, adventurer! Are you looking for a specific potion or ingredient?

npcs.name: Barmaid Violet
utterances: Welcome friend, welcome.  I hope you brought your appetite with you!

npcs.name: Barry Viceheart
utterances: I don't think you want to help me with this difficult task. Farewell!

npcs.name: Bonin Broadhammer
utterances: Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Welcome! What can I help you with?

npcs.name: Burk Stoneshatter
utterances: I'm rather busy and cannot speak. Sorry.

npcs.name: Carpenter Jorgie Icearmor
utterances: A good day's work is the measure of worth!

npcs.name: Coppershot
utterances: If yer comin' in here to fight an' make trouble, the Graystone Watch will toss you out on your backside!
Welcome to the Frozen Tundra Tavern where the grog flows like the Ocean of Tears.
I can't stand the ice! Give me halls of stone! The barbarians seem to prefer the name and I prefer their coin.

npcs.name: Dorak Everstock
utterances: You have learned everything I have to teach at the moment.  You are free to use our crafting facilities to hone your skills.

npcs.name: Dori
utterances: Greetin's, young'n. My name's Dori and this here is my bank. As a customer of the Qeynos Exchange, you can be certain your money's safe with us!

npcs.name: Dunda Frostgrip
utterances: Speak to me sometime when I'm not busy.

npcs.name: Fiercecry errr
utterances: We are the Graystone Watch. We're here to prevent trouble in our village.

npcs.name: Gnor Farven
utterances: Sorry, it's near impossible for me to drink and talk at the same time.

npcs.name: Golan Panicward
utterances: Ah, what I wouldn't give to cradle a mug of good Dwarven Ale just now.
A hard day of adventuring makes one long for home, don't it?
At least one of your parents wasn't a elf. You might have a chance to grow hair on your face.

npcs.name: Graystone Courier Dirvel
utterances: I need a break like Lucan needs a vacation.
Please come back later. I am very, very busy.
Wow, this shipment is days old!
Goodness, I don't think I'll ever get done with this work.

npcs.name: Gruffin Goldtooth
utterances: Hey there, young 'in.  Don't mind ole' Gruffin.  I'm just inspecting these here mineral veins.  This bedrock is going to be especially useful for building new homes for refugees and citizens alike.

npcs.name: Gurna Hadel
utterances: Come back when you've got brew!

npcs.name: Hargan Icethaw
utterances: Ahhhh ... Nothing's more rewarding than building up a good, hearty sweat after a long day's work!

npcs.name: Innkeep Rothskild
utterances: Hello there <player name>, what can I help you with?

npcs.name: Ironmallet
utterances: I'm just the help around here.  But someday I will have my own forge ... Ironmallet's House of ... er ... well ... something!  The name will come to me someday.

npcs.name: Jodi
utterances: Hmmm... I think I'll pick up the potions myself.

npcs.name: Karg Icemoore
utterances: Welcome to the Frozen Tundra, finest brewhall in all of Qeynos--no--finest brewhall in all of Norrath!! Belly up to Coppershot. He'll get yer order.

npcs.name: Kaya
utterances: Welcome to my humble shop.  We have quite a selection of weapons to choose from.  See for yourself...
Never can you go into battle without a tried and trusted weapon. Here, take a look at what we have in stock.

npcs.name: Keldra Frosthaven
utterances: Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.

npcs.name: Knight-Captain Salomar
utterances: Ah ... on second thought you had better broaden your training before serving the Qeynos Guard.  Good day, citizen!

npcs.name: Lars Silverbrace
utterances: The Ironforge Exchange constructed, brewed, tailored, forged, baked, or scribed just about everything you see here in Qeynos.
The Tunarian Alliance refuses to acknowledge that a balance can be found between the growing needs of our citizenry and the desire to preserve the woodlands.
The Qeynos Guard recruits those who are attracted to physical activity but lack the creativity and talent required to join the Ironforge Exchange.
The Concordium are so consumed by their ancient tomes and dead languages that they fail to see the world right before their own noses.

npcs.name: Marus Donoval
utterances: Hey! I'm relaxing here.

npcs.name: Mav Boilfist
utterances: Sorry, I'm terribly busy right now. No time to chat.

npcs.name: McGuiggen
utterances: Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.

npcs.name: Pathfinder Silentstride
utterances: Greetings, adventurer. Be careful travling outside the city.The nearby wilderness is as unforgiving as the fates themselves.

npcs.name: Rafki
utterances: Please mind the plates -- they're very hot.

npcs.name: Shipping Coordinator Hando
utterances: Listen, I'm sure sitting around chewing the fat with you is a great way to pass the time, but I'm busy here and can't be bothered with small talk.

npcs.name: Snowboot
utterances: Aye, what is it? I've got to be fitting this elven lass, and I haven't got all day! Come on, out with it!

npcs.name: Soulforge
utterances: If steel is what you seek, traveler, then look no further.

npcs.name: Steelvein
utterances: Welcome! What is it I can help you with?

npcs.name: Tacklemaster Moyna
utterances: Welcome to Graystone! With our Kerran population, the fish supply is never enough. If you're looking to fill that supply, you'll need some of my goods. Care to have a look?
You're in luck. I need more bait.  If you're interested, you could fetch me some centipede meat. Ubani and Brice catch all the fish from the pier, and I always need more bait.

It'll pay but not too well.  The bait business is decent next to the pier, but the stuff isn't exactly worth its weight in platinum, if you know what I mean.  I need you to gather some centipede meat for me from the Forest Ruins.

npcs.name: Watcher Curmogliel Kar`thal
utterances: The Celestial Watch is ever vigilant. Rest will come only after the tyranny of evil can be undone.
